elementSpec.desc: contains a representation of some written source in the form of a set of images rather than as transcribed or encoded text.
TO BE TRANSLATED

classSpec.desc: elements which can be associated with an image or a surface within a facsimile element.

attDef.desc: points directly to an image, or to a part of a facsimile element which corresponds with this element.
attDef.valDesc: one or more URIs, separated by white space.

elementSpec.desc: defines a written surface in terms of a rectangular coordinate space, optionally grouping one or more graphic representations of that space, and rectangular zones of interest within it.
TO BE TRANSLATED

attDef.desc: points to an element which encodes the starting position of the text corresponding to the inscribed part of the surface.

classSpec.desc: elements which can be positioned within a two dimensional coordinate system.

attDef.desc: gives the x coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space.
gives the y coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space.
gives the x coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space.
gives the y coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space.

elementSpec.desc: defines a rectangular area contained within a surface element.
TO BE TRANSLATED
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text added by an author, scribe, annotator or corrector (see also add).
TO BE TRANSLATED
contains an area of damage to the text witness.
TO BE TRANSLATED
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text which is damaged in some way but still legible.
TO BE TRANSLATED
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise signaled as superfluous or spurious by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
TO BE TRANSLATED
contains a sequence of letters added by an editor or transcriber when expanding an abbreviation.
TO BE TRANSLATED
contains a running head (e.g. a header, footer), catchword, or similar material appearing on the current page.
TO BE TRANSLATED

attDef.desc: classifies the material encoded according to some useful typology.

valItem.desc: a running title at the top of the page
a running title at the bottom of the page
a page number or foliation symbol
a line number, either of prose or poetry

elementSpec.desc: contains one or more handNote elements documenting the different hands identified within the source texts.
TO BE TRANSLATED
marks the beginning of a sequence of text written in a new hand, or the beginning of a scribal stint.
TO BE TRANSLATED

attDef.valDesc: must be one of the hand identifiers declared in the document header (see section ).

attDef.desc: signifies the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the change of hand.
attDef.valDesc: must be one of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding (see chapter ).

elementSpec.desc: contains a sequence of letters or signs present in an abbreviation which are omitted or replaced in the expanded form of the abbreviation.
TO BE TRANSLATED
indicates restoration of text to an earlier state by cancellation of an editorial or authorial marking or instruction.
TO BE TRANSLATED
indicates the location of a significant space in the copy text.
TO BE TRANSLATED

attDef.desc: indicates whether the space is horizontal or vertical.
indicates the individual responsible for identifying and measuring the space.
attDef.valDesc: a pointer to one of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding

elementSpec.desc: groups one or more deletions with one or more additions when the combination is to be regarded as a single intervention in the text.
TO BE TRANSLATED
signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor for any reason, typically because the original cannot be read because of physical damage or loss to the original.
TO BE TRANSLATED

attDef.desc: indicates why the text has had to be supplied.
attDef.valDesc: any phrase describing the difficulty, e.g. overbinding, faded ink, lost folio, omitted in original.
